fields.description:
This seems to be a regression (EUCA-7726).
When using access policies with an [AWS support ARN format|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-arns-and-namespaces.html], Eucalyptus responds back with a malformed document error.
The following ARN formats are supported by AWS: 

arn:aws:service:region:account:resource
arn:aws:service:region:account:resourcetype/resource
arn:aws:service:region:account:resourcetype:resource

*Details*
The following policy was tested against both AWS and Eucalyptus:
{code}
{
  "Statement": [
    {
      "Action": [
        "ec2:DescribeInstances"
      ],
      "Effect": "Allow",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:*:408396244283:instance/*"
    }
  ]
}
{code}

The above works in AWS and fails in Eucalyptus with the error:
{code}

Thu Sep 4 09:48:07 2014 DEBUG [PolicyParser:Euare.17] Syntax error in input policy with exception net.sf.json.JSONException: 'arn:aws:ec2:*:408396244283:instance/*' is not a valid ARN | com.eucalyptus.auth.policy.ern.Ern.parse(Ern.java:107) | com.eucalyptus.auth.policy.PolicyParser.decomposeStatement(PolicyParser.java:285) | com.eucalyptus.auth.policy.PolicyParser.parseAuthorizations(PolicyParser.java:258) | com.eucalyptus.auth.policy.PolicyParser.parseStatement(PolicyParser.java:207) | com.eucalyptus.auth.policy.PolicyParser.parseStatements(PolicyParser.java:182) | com.eucalyptus.auth.policy.PolicyParser.parse(PolicyParser.java:163) | com.eucalyptus.auth.DatabaseGroupProxy.storePolicy(DatabaseGroupProxy.java:297) | com.eucalyptus.auth.DatabaseGroupProxy.putPolicy(DatabaseGroupProxy.java:283) | com.eucalyptus.auth.Privileged.putGroupPolicy(Privileged.java:465) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.EuareService.putGroupPolicy(EuareService.java:713) |

fields.summary: Resource ARN in Policy Doesn't Follow AWS Behavior

comments.body: I don't think this is a regression, we have not supported region or account numbers in EC2 resource ARNs.  ARN parsing was recently updated for 4.1 (EUCA-9936) to allow for account numbers in EC2 ARNs but not to allow for a region.

Hey [~sjones],

Thanks for the response.  Much appreciated.  Do we have a listing of what is currently supported in 4.0.x and will be supported in 4.1 - regarding each service (i.e. arn:aws:service...)?  I checked out documentation in the following resources, but nothing popped out at me:

* https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/wiki/Behavioral-Changes-in-Eucalyptus-4.0.0
* https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/ARCH/4.0
* https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/ARCH/4.1

Thanks again for your help with this.

[~hspencer], I don't recall any significant change for ARNs in 4.0. Once 4.1 gets closer to completion we will likely document the behavioural changes for the release. Ideally there should not be any differences in what we accept vs AWS/IAM for ARNs in policies (or for actions, etc)

In addition to allowing a region to be specified in an ARN when parsing policies we would have to extract/store the region and match regions as well as resource names / account when evaluating policy (i.e. the region becomes part of the namespace for a resource type). This would also mean we would need to know which region we were in when evaluating policy (perhaps using "eucalyptus" for now)
In 4.1 we allow a wildcard for the region '*', but do not support a specified region.
